Reverse image search: The expert performed a reverse image search to verify the authenticity of the claim. This search revealed that the picture in question was taken in April 2019 during the Lok Sabha elections, not on their way to Hathras.
Social media trends: The expert noted that the picture had been trending on social media recently, with users claiming it was taken on Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi's way to Hathras. This trend prompted the expert to investigate and verify the claim.
Archived tweet: The expert mentioned that an AVBP member, Anima Sonkar, had tweeted about the picture and claimed it showed the Gandhi siblings on their way to Hathras. Although Sonkar later deleted the tweet, an archived link was available for reference.
Media coverage: The expert referred to various news outlets, such as The Indian Express, NDTV, Dainik Jagran, Navbharat Times, Punjab Kesari, and India TV, which had covered the meeting between Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi in April 2019. These outlets had published pictures and videos of the siblings laughing and posing for photos, confirming that the viral image was from that meeting and not related to Hathras.
